definition: to make a detour/to take the long route
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: We have to shunpike there's a tailback in the city.
sentences.chinese: 现在城里正在塞车排长队，我们得绕路而行了。

sentences.english: I always detour the way to my home because I want to meet you.
sentences.chinese: 我常常绕路回家只是为了遇见你。

sentences.english: Master you took the wrong way, please don't detour, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 师傅你走错了，请别绕路，谢谢。

to take a shortcut
to take the back roads/to take the side streets/to take the small paths
shortcut
detour/long way around

bon voyage/Godspeed

route/path traveled/distance traveled/course (of development)

to change route/to divert (a road or a watercourse)
